schedule.title: Weekly schedule
schedule.description: Set time windows in which message dispatch is allowed.

instructions.title: Installation Instructions
instructions.importance_text: CRON is responsible for automatically sending emails from the queue, processing schedules, and maintenance operations. Without proper CRON configuration, scheduled messages will not be sent.
instructions.docker_text: In a Docker environment, the scheduler is started automatically when the containers are active.
instructions.linux_text: Add an entry to crontab with the command {command}:
instructions.linux_warning: Replace {path} with the actual path to your application directory.
instructions.automation_text: You can run CRON from external automation tools via {bold}. Simply call the endpoint every minute.
instructions.forge_text: Laravel Forge: The scheduler is automatically configured for every Laravel application. Simply enable the "Schedule" option in the server panel.
instructions.vapor_text: Laravel Vapor: The scheduler is built into the serverless environment and works automatically.
instructions.n8n_note: Use the {node} node with a {trigger} trigger every minute.
instructions.make_note: Use the {module} module with scheduling set to every minute.

webhook.title: Webhook Configuration
webhook.no_token: Generate an API token to use the webhook.

verification.title: How to verify?
verification.step1: After proper configuration, the red warning bar will disappear automatically
verification.step2: In the "Statistics" tab, run data will appear
verification.step3: In the "History" tab, you will see execution logs
verification.step4: On the Dashboard, a widget with the CRON status will appear

setup.title: NetSendo Installation
setup.intro: Enter your license key to start the system configuration

marketplace.title: Marketplace
marketplace.subtitle: Connect NetSendo with your favorite tools and platforms. Extended integrations coming soon!
marketplace.banner_desc: We are building a comprehensive marketplace of integrations to help you connect NetSendo with the tools you already use. Stay tuned for updates!

woocommerce.title: WooCommerce
woocommerce.description: Professional subscription forms and customer synchronization for WooCommerce stores.
woocommerce.hero_subtitle: Integrate your WooCommerce store with NetSendo - automatically add customers to mailing lists after purchase.
woocommerce.hero_description: The NetSendo for WooCommerce plugin allows you to automatically add customers to mailing lists after a purchase or attempted purchase (unpaid order). You can also redirect customers to external sales funnel pages.

auto_subscribe.title: Automatic Subscription
auto_subscribe.description: Automatically add customers to mailing lists after purchasing a product.

cart_recovery.title: Cart Recovery
cart_recovery.description: Save customers with unpaid orders to a separate list for follow-up.

product_settings.title: Per-product Settings
product_settings.description: Override default lists for specific WooCommerce products.

external_pages.title: External Pages
external_pages.description: Redirect customers to external sales funnel pages after purchase.

download.title: Download Plugin
download.description: Click the button below to download the NetSendo for WooCommerce plugin.

install.title: Install in WordPress
install.description: Go to WordPress ‚Üí Plugins ‚Üí Add New ‚Üí Upload Plugin, and install the downloaded ZIP file.

configure.title: Configure Connection
configure.description: In WordPress go to WooCommerce ‚Üí NetSendo, enter NetSendo URL and API Key, then save settings before testing connection.

lists.title: Set Default Lists
lists.description: Select lists where customers should be added after purchase and for unpaid orders.

wordpress.title: WordPress
wordpress.hero_subtitle: Professional subscription forms and content gating for bloggers and content creators on WordPress.
wordpress.hero_description: The NetSendo for WordPress plugin is a complete solution for bloggers and content creators. Add professional newsletter subscription forms, limit article visibility to subscribers only, and build your mailing list from WordPress.

welcome.documentation_desc: Laravel has wonderful documentation covering every aspect of the framework. Whether you are a newcomer or have prior experience with Laravel, we recommend reading our documentation from beginning to end.
welcome.laracasts_desc: Laracasts offers thousands of video tutorials on Laravel, PHP, and JavaScript development. Check them out, see for yourself, and massively level up your development skills in the process.
welcome.news_desc: Laravel News is a community driven portal and newsletter aggregating all of the latest and most important news in the Laravel ecosystem, including new package releases and tutorials.
welcome.ecosystem_desc: Laravel robust library of first-party tools and libraries, such as Forge, Vapor, Nova, Envoyer, and Herd help you take your projects to the next level.

forgot_password.title: Forgot Password
forgot_password.intro: Forgot your password? No problem. Just let us know your email address and we will email you a password reset link that will allow you to choose a new one.

confirm_password.title: Confirm Password
confirm_password.intro: This is a secure area of the application. Please confirm your password before continuing.

verify_email.title: Email Verification
verify_email.intro: Thanks for signing up! Before getting started, could you verify your email address by clicking on the link we just emailed to you? If you did not receive the email, we will gladly send you another.
verify_email.link_sent: A new verification link has been sent to the email address you provided during registration.

webhook_reset.title: Reset Password
webhook_reset.content: Enter your email address to reset your password. The system will process your request and you will receive a new password via email.
webhook_reset.success: A new password has been generated and sent to your email address.

two_factor.enabled_subtitle: Your account is protected with an additional layer of security
two_factor.disabled_subtitle: Add an additional layer of protection to your account
two_factor.intro: Two-factor authentication adds an additional layer of security to your account. In addition to your password, you will need a code from an authenticator app (e.g., Google Authenticator, Authy).
two_factor.scan_qr_subtitle: Use an authenticator app (Google Authenticator, Authy, etc.) to scan the following code:

delete.title: Delete Account
delete.description: Once your account is deleted, all of its resources and data will be permanently deleted. Before deleting your account, please download any data or information that you wish to retain.
delete.confirm_title: Are you sure you want to delete your account?
delete.confirm_description: Once your account is deleted, all of its resources and data will be permanently deleted. Please enter your password to confirm you would like to permanently delete your account.

settings.retention_desc: Logs older than the set time will be automatically deleted by CRON
settings.cron_info_desc: The logs:clean command runs every hour via CRON. It checks the log file age and clears it if it exceeds the set retention time.

stripe.secret_key_help: The secret key is used for Stripe API communication. Do not share it with anyone.
stripe.webhook_secret_help: The webhook secret is used to verify events coming from Stripe.
stripe.status_ready: You can create products and accept payments.
stripe.status_add_keys: Add API keys to activate the integration.
stripe.api_key_missing: API key missing. Save settings first.
stripe.invalid_api_key: Invalid API key. Check if keys are correct.
stripe.help_text: You can find API keys in your Stripe dashboard under Developers ‚Üí API keys. Use live keys for production or test keys for testing.
stripe.oauth_connect_desc: Quick and secure connection to your Stripe account without copying API keys.
stripe.oauth_disconnect_confirm: Are you sure you want to disconnect your Stripe account?
stripe.oauth_client_id_missing: Stripe Client ID is not configured. Contact your administrator or use the API keys method.
stripe.oauth_setup_step1_1: Log in to the Stripe Dashboard
stripe.oauth_setup_step1_2: Go to Settings ‚Üí Connect ‚Üí OAuth settings
stripe.oauth_setup_step1_3: Copy your Client ID (starts with ca_)
stripe.oauth_setup_step2_desc: Copy the URL below and paste it as Redirect URI in Stripe OAuth settings:
stripe.oauth_setup_step3_desc: Paste the copied Client ID from Stripe dashboard and save:
stripe.oauth_save_client_id_first: Please save the Client ID above first.
stripe.oauth_permissions_list: read_write (full account access) - required for payments and webhooks
stripe.webhook_url_help: Copy this URL and configure it as the webhook endpoint in Stripe Dashboard.
stripe.webhook_setup_title: How to set up webhook in Stripe:
stripe.webhook_setup_step1: Go to Stripe Dashboard ‚Üí Developers ‚Üí Webhooks
stripe.webhook_setup_step2: Click 'Add endpoint' and paste the URL above
stripe.webhook_setup_step3: Select events to listen to (list below) and copy the Signing secret

polar.title: Polar
polar.description: Developer-first payment infrastructure. Checkouts, subscriptions, and usage-based billing.
polar.long_description: Polar is a modern payment platform that enables selling digital products, subscriptions, and usage-based billing in a simple and intuitive way.
polar.help_description: Check the Polar documentation for detailed setup instructions.
polar.webhook_info: Use this URL as the webhook endpoint in your Polar settings.
polar.environment_help: Use Sandbox for testing. Production is for real payments.
polar.access_token_placeholder: Paste your access token from Polar...
polar.access_token_help: You can find the access token in your organization settings in Polar.
polar.access_token_missing: Access token missing. Save settings first.
polar.webhook_secret_help: The webhook secret is used to verify incoming events from Polar.
polar.webhook_url_help: Copy this URL and configure it in your Polar webhook settings.
polar.webhook_setup_title: How to set up webhook in Polar:
polar.webhook_setup_step1: Go to Polar Dashboard ‚Üí Settings ‚Üí Webhooks
polar.webhook_setup_step2: Click 'Create Webhook' and paste the URL above
polar.webhook_setup_step3: Select events to listen to, then copy the generated Secret

polar.not_configured_desc: Add an access token to activate the integration.

pixel.custom_events_description: You can send custom events from JavaScript using the NetSendo Pixel API.
pixel.identify_description: Link an anonymous visitor to a known subscriber. Use after login or after form submission with email.
pixel.debug_description: Enable browser console logging (F12) to see all events sent by the pixel.
